message.content:
<<SYS>> Ahah! I'd be happy to help!

To align a row of divs to the right using flexbox, you can use the `justify-content` property and set it to `flex-end`. Here's an example:
```css
.container {
  display: flex;
  justify-content: flex-end;
}

.div1, .div2, .div3 {
  width: 100px;
  height: 50px;
  background-color: #f0f0f0;
  margin: 10px;
}
```
In this example, the `.container` div is set to `display: flex`, which makes its children (`.div1`, `.div2`, and `.div3`) flexible items. The `justify-content: flex-end` property aligns these items to the right.

You can also use `flex-grow` or `margin-left` properties to achieve similar results.
```css
.container {
  display: flex;
}

.div1, .div2, .div3 {
  width: 100px;
  height: 50px;
  background-color: #f0f0f0;
  margin-left: auto;
}
```
Or:
```css
.container {
  display: flex;
}

.div1, .div2, .div3 {
  width: 100px;
  height: 50px;
  background-color: #f0f0f0;
  flex-grow: 1;
}
```
Let me know if you have any other questions or need further assistance!
